children.subject: Well I know Givental does something similar (Take a look at his curves for math 104)
He thought Math 53 in Spring 2014 and curved to a B-. You can see the distribution on ScheduleBuilder

history.content: As Anonymous below says, you'll probably be fine and get at least a B+ if you can stay above the median. It wouldn't exactly be fair to blame the EECS department for the policies of the Mathematics department.

children.subject:
Note that the average GPAs for the intro classes last semester have been 3.1 (61A), 3.3 (61B), 2.9 (61C), and 3.1 (70). Even if Wodzicki does this, rest assured that your CS lower divs are also ignoring the department policy and giving you an already inflated GPA, so everything balances out :)

(In other words, if you're going to complain to the CS department, complain about their own instructors ignoring policy, not about a math instructor).

history.content: I'm currently enrolled in Math 54 with professor Wodzicki and several times during lecture he's threatened to curve the class around a C-/D+ average, which not only is pretty unreasonable (considering how most math classes are curved around a B and that the other 54 class with Pachter has tests with a median in the 90s) but also I'm sure would be catastrophic for a lot of people in the class, especially people that want to declare CS and need to make the GPA cutoff. I scored slightly above the median for the first midterm but I can't see myself even getting a B if he curves around a C-. Several people have told me that there's no policy in the math department about requiring professors to curve around a B- like in the CS department, so I'm really worried about my grade because I honestly believe that Wodzicki is not joking around (especially because he has tenure). I have been really stressed about this and I guess I just want to know what's going to happen (e.g he's allowed to do this so just brace yourself, or no, he probably won't do it and is just saying he will). I've heard stories about crazy professors but are they really allowed be this unreasonable and have so much freedom?
history.subject: Wodzicki Math 54
